course.subject: ENGG
course.name: Engineering Team Airship Design
course.description: The Engineering Team Airship Competition allows students to explore various areas of engineering in order to design and build a remote controlled airship, culminating in the final competition before the end of the semester. Students will use these specific project requirements as an opportunity to explore activities in which managers/engineers of various disciplines are involved. Specifically, they will build an airship that uses helium balloons for lift, has motors and propellers for propulsion and control, and is controlled remotely using an Android device. The course is designed in a way to allow students without engineering background to have a fun hands-on experience, students from all schools are welcome.

reviews.author: Aye
reviews.comment_content:
Build an airship with everything done by yourselves with the given budget. Nearly no electronics experience, some programming with android studio and most about the structure of the airship.
Including a presentation, a quiz and two competitions.
reviews.comment_teaching: STAs help you. Some knowledge was taught but they are less important than hand-on experiences.
reviews.comment_grading: Somehow can't be handled. It mostly depends on whether your airship can beat others' in the competitions. Overall it is good, but not great.
reviews.comment_workload: Very large when it is next to the competitions. Stay up late and build the airship. If you cannot communicate well with your teammates, it will be extremely boring just staying there!

reviews.author: TY
reviews.comment_content:
electronic個part比較簡單，唔難， 有上elec1100 ge應該唔會有咩問題。
Programming個part都幾煩，個program十分重要，幾影響你部野飛成點。
mechanics個part其實係講common sense，無咩特別，唔洗計下數，睇下個design work唔work，主要都係trial and error
reviews.comment_teaching: 每組都有一個ta，有咩問題都可以問ta，佢地都會幫你手。
reviews.comment_workload:
無midterm,final
有兩份reflection要寫，同埋一，兩份功課。(每份大約30分鐘就做完)
有兩次demo,final個一個都幾重分,要認真d
做完第一次demo之後仲有一個presentation講下你個design同改進方案

reviews.author: PK
reviews.title: An interesting introductory course
reviews.comment_content:
Although the course is a 2000 course, it doesn’t like other 2000 courses, in which some related knowledge and experiences are required/ expected.

Basically, the course is a group project, in which you have to build an Airship that uses helium balloons and propellers for lift and propulsion, and is controlled remotely using an Android device. At the beginning, you will be assigned to a group of 4-5. Then, you will learn some fundamental knowledge of electronics and programming, so as to build and control the Airship. In the Final Demonstration, you will need to perform tasks like traveling past an obstacle, landing on the center of the target.

As I mentioned before, this is an introductory course. Therefore, all the knowledge required will be covered in the Lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching: Each group will be assigned a TA. Both the professor and TAs are very nice and willing to help you.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade is quite good that if you attend all the classes (because you need to really build the airship), then B or above should be secured.
reviews.comment_workload: No reading, no homework, no exam. Only Two demonstrations and one presentation after the final demonstration.
